title: Senior Content Strategist - London Based
content:
ABOUT OGILVY SOCIAL.LAB
At Ogilvy Social.Lab, we combine the power of creativity and expertise in modern marketing to build brands in the digital era. Our capabilities span across Social, Advertising, TikTok, Consulting, PR & Influence, Experience and Commerce.Our agency has leading expertise in Social thanks to our Social.Lab heritage and we have a specialty around working for HQ, global and regional brands. Our client portfolio includes brands like IKEA, Vans, Absolut, Ford, Nestlé, L’Oréal, Amazon or The Coca-Cola Company.
ROLE
We are looking for a Senior Content Strategist to join a dedicated content studio for a premium global brand in the food and beverage category. Our ideal candidate thrives on creating content that solve business challenges – and enjoys collaborating with other experts to see the strategy come to life in execution.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
Major task headings:

Focus: content strategy for asset delivery across a range of touch-points including social, digital, retail and B2B.
Ability to work with the client to set the brand content strategy, refine project briefs and translate challenges into compelling content solutions.
Work hands-on with the creative and production studio teams to ensure projects are executed on-strategy and on-brand.
Oversee the studio data analyst to develop data-driven insights, content trend reports and effective measurement of content performance.
Inspire client and studio teams with best-in-class learnings across different objectives – from hard-working performance content to social content that drives cultural relevance and cut-through.

 
PROFILE

6-8 years+ experience as a content or social / digital strategist.
Dynamic, solutions-focused and people oriented.
Full English proficiency including written and oral communication.
Hands-on experience in content strategy and development of channel plans, consumer journeys and content calendars to guide execution.
Expertise in digital and social content formats and channel best practice.
Strong critical thinking skills - analytical, creative and lateral.
Ability to tell and sell a story with strong presentation and writing skills.
Digitally savvy and up to date with content trends and social media developments.
Comfortable working independently as well as collaboratively in a team.

 
OFFER

Fulltime opportunity in an ever-growing, trendsetting advertising agency based in the greenest building in Brussels – the new WPP Campus.
Work alongside a team of diverse and people-focused individuals, on impactful projects and with an array of local, regional and global clients.
We are committed to keeping our environmental footprint low and ensuring that our work is ethical.
We thrive on transparency – our words and promises produce actions.
Enjoy attractive employment benefits including:

A flexible working policy
Eco vouchers
Cafeteria plans
3 insurance options
A car or mobility budget (seniority-dependant),
Relevant IT equipment
Access to the company rooftop to take an occasional break, while overlooking the breath-taking city

As an Ogilvy Social. Lab employee, you will be provided with continuous opportunities to grow through training, and career conversations, while doing strong work, that works on a daily basis.



At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
